p: Estimates of Microcystis aeruginosa complex (MAC) and/or other cyanobacteria in non-bloom conditions for the summer periods (December–February) of 2011–2017 are presented (Table 1). Blooms were noticed in both cities of Tapes and São Lourenço do Sul at the west margin of PL during the summer period of 2011–2012 with similar concentration (maximum up to 4 × 10 4 cell mL −1). The highest abundance was determined for the summer of 2016–2017 in Tapes only (attaining 2.3 × 10 6 cell mL −1), when there was a bloom of MAC. During this latter period, intense chlorophyll- a stripes were visible in an image derived from the Landsat-8 ETM+ but mainly near São Lourenço do Sul and Pelotas (see Figure 1). In the other summer periods, filamentous cyanobacteria were prominent such as Dolichospermum, Gleiterinema, and Limnothrix along with chroococcaleans ( Merismopedia and Microcystis) denoting a mixed assemblage of cyanobacteria species (Table 1). In the summer of 2011–2012, benthic filaments of Anabaena spp. were also noticed.
